text: The certificate of sale or assignment of the certificate of sale is presumptive evidence in all judicial proceedings by and against the purchaser, and the purchaser's representatives, heirs and assigns, of the:
historical:
Temporary Addition of Section

For temporary (225 day) addition of section, see § 7 of Real Property Tax Clarity and Litter Control Administration Temporary Amendment Act of 2001 (D.C. Law 14-8, June 13, 2001, law notification 48 DCR 5916).

Emergency Act Amendments

For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 7 of Real Property Tax Clarity and Litter Control Administration Emergency Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14- 22, March 16, 2001, 48 DCR 2706).

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 13-305, see notes under § 47-901.

DC CODE § 47-1351

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: Truth of the statements in the certificate of sale or assignment of the certificate of sale;
Interest of the purchaser in the real property described;
Regularity and validity of all proceedings regarding the taxes for which the real property was sold; and

title.text: Taxation, Licensing, Permits, Assessments, and Fees. (Refs & Annos)
